a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)

48.brief: who? (occasionally, by a peculiar idiom, of things); also (indefinitely) whoever; often used in oblique construction with prefix or suffix
properly, a valiant man or warrior; generally, a person simply
to live, whether literally or figuratively; causatively, to revive
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
death (natural or violent); concretely, the dead, their place or state (hades); figuratively, pestilence, ruin
properly, to be smooth, i.e. (by implication) to escape (as if by slipperiness); causatively, to release or rescue; specifically, to bring forth young, emit sparks
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
Hades or the world of the dead (as if a subterranean retreat), including its accessories and inmates

49.brief: kindness; by implication (towards God) piety; rarely (by opposition) reproof, or (subject.) beauty
first, in place, time or rank (as adjective or noun)
the Lord (used as a proper name of God only)
to seven oneself, i.e. swear (as if by repeating a declaration seven times)
David, the youngest son of Jesse
literally firmness; figuratively security; morally fidelity

50.brief: properly, to mark (so as to be recognized), i.e. to remember; by implication, to mention;  to be male
the Lord (used as a proper name of God only)
to lift, in a great variety of applications, literal and figurative, absolute and relative
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
abundant (in quantity, size, age, number, rank, quality)
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock

51.brief: who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
to pull off, i.e. (by implication) to expose (as by stripping); specifically, to betroth (as if a surrender); figuratively, to carp at, i.e. defame; to spend the winter
